alert.note: Alert for Benton (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 8:29AM CDT until July 30 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton. In northeast Oklahoma, Delaware. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Jay... Bella Vista... Lowell... Pea Ridge... Gentry... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... Colcord... Highfill... Disney... Springtown... Maysville... Hiwasse... Northwest Arkansas Regional Airport... Chloeta... Miller... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
